format:
Langren1644: A data frame with 12 observations on the following 9 variables,
giving determinations of the distance in longitude between Toledo and Rome, from the 1644 graph.
reference:
In all the graphs, Toledo is implicitly at the origin and Rome is located relatively at the value of Longitude  
To judge correspondence with an actual map, the positions in (lat, long) are
description:
Description
Michael Florent van Langren (1598-1675) was a Dutch mathematician and astronomer, who served
as a royal mathematician to King Phillip IV of Spain, and who worked on one of the most significant
problems of his time— the accurate determination of longitude, particularly for navigation at sea.
In order to convince the Spanish court of the seriousness of the problem (often resulting in
great losses through ship wrecks), he prepared a 1-dimensional line graph, showing all the 
available estimates of the distance in longitude between Toledo and Rome, which showed
large errors, for even this modest distance.  This 1D line graph, from Langren (1644), is believed
to be the first known graph of statistical data (Friendly etal., 2010).
It provides a compelling example of the notions of statistical variability and bias.
The data frame Langren1644 gives the estimates and other information derived from the
previously known 1644 graph.  
It turns out that van Langren produced other versions of this graph, as early as 1628.
The data frame Langren.all gives the estimates derived
from all known versions of this graph.
title: van Langren's Data on Longitude Distance between Toledo and Rome

parameters.Country: The country where this person worked; a factor with levels Belgium Denmark Egypt Flanders France Germany Italy Italy
parameters.City: The principal city where this person worked; a factor with levels Alexandria Amsterdam Bamberg Bologna Frankfurt Hven Leuven Middelburg Nuremberg Padua Paris Rome
parameters.Longitude: Estimated value of the longitude distance between Toledo and Rome
parameters.Latitude: Latitude of this City; a numeric vector
parameters.Source: Likely source for this determination of Longitude; a factor with levels Astron Map
parameters.Longname: A longer version of the Name, where appropriate; a factor with levels Andrea Argoli Christoph Clavius  Tycho Brahe
parameters.Name: The name of the person giving a determination, a factor with levels A. Argelius ... T. Brahe
parameters.Gap: A numeric vector indicating whether the Longitude value is below or above the median
